addincome.help:
This adds an income attached to a role, that will give any players with that role the specified income whenever they use the /incomes command.

A plain number will work for a gold income. For resource incomes, use  the format <NUMBER> <RESOURCE NAME>

Example: '/addincome @role 100' creates a new income of 100 gold for the role @role.

Example: '/addincome @role 10 wood' creates a new income of 10 wood for the role @role.

craft.help:
Crafts the specified recipe. If the recipe is not in the recipe list, it will not work- the recipe list can be found with /allrecipes.

You must have the necessary prerequisites to craft a recipe- use /inspectrecipe for more information.

You can only have 3 recipes being crafted at once.

Note: the recipe will take the ingredients when you start crafting it, but will not give you the results until you finish crafting it.

Without a specified command, this will list all the commands. With a command, it will show the description, options, and help for that command.

Admins, for lists of and help with admin commands, use /adminhelp

options.command: The command you want helped with
The command you want helped with

inspectrecipe.help: Lists basic information about a recipe, including necessary roles, ingredients and results.

buysale.help:
Buy a specified sale from the market, using the numeric ID. Use /sales to list the sales. If you want to buy more than one, use the second box to specify the number, otherwise leave blank

This is different than buying items from the shop

inspectsale.help: Inspect a specified sale from the market, using the numeric ID. Use /sales to list the sales

sales.help: List all sales in the market

sell.help:
Post a sale for an item in the market. Use the second box to specify the quantity of the item, and the third box to specify the price. If you want to sell more than one, use the second box to specify the number, otherwise leave blank

You will not be paid until the item is sold

additem.help:
Add an item to the shop. If you want to write large paragraphs, /additemmodal may be easier to use. The categories 'itemname', 'itemicon', 'itemdescription', and 'itemcategory' must be filled out. Item category is case sensitive.

You may also add 'itemprice' if you want to set a price for the item- this will add the item to the shop as well

additemmodal.help: Same as the additem command, merely in a modal format- i.e. a pop up menu. Easier to write large paragraphs.

addrecipe.help:
Creates a new recipe. If given a name, it will create a new recipe with that name.

If no name is given, it will create a new recipe with the name 'New Recipe' and a number added to the end to distinguish it. No two recipes can have identical names.

If the given name matches an item, and a recipe for that item does not already exist, this will automatically swap to a recipe to craft that item.

Recipes are automatically hidden from users- edit the 'Is Public' field to make it visible.

allitems.help: Lists all items, even those not in the shop, alphabetically

buyitem.help: Buy an item from the shop. If you want to buy more than one, use the first box to specify the number, otherwise leave blank

options.numbertobuy: How many do you want to buy

edititemfield.help:
Edits the specified field of the item you most recently used /edititemmenu on.

Any field with (#) at the end must be given a plain integer value.

Any field with (Y/N) at the end must be given either 'Y', 'Yes', 'N', or 'No'.

Give Item or Take Item fields should be in the format 'NUMBER' 'ITEM NAME'
Ex. '10 Wood'.

Images must be submitted via a link to the image- pasting an image in discord and clicking 'Open in Browser' creates a working link

Role fields must be submitted with a single message and all roles must be @ mentioned.
Ex. @Role1, @Role2, @Role3.

Items are not automatically put in the shop- give them a price to place them in the shop.
edititemfield.description: Edit a field of an item in the shop. Use /edititemmenu first to see the fields of an item

edititemmenu.help:
This lists out all the fields of the item, and their current values.

This command cannot actually change values, use /editfield to change values

editrecipefield.help:
Edits the specified field of the recipe you most recently used /editrecipemenu on.

Any field with (#) at the end must be given a plain integer value.

Any field with (Y/N) at the end must be given either 'Y', 'Yes', 'N', or 'No'.

Ingredient or Result fields should be in the format 'NUMBER' 'ITEM NAME'
Ex. '10 Wood'.

Images must be submitted via a link to the image- pasting an image in discord and clicking 'Open in Browser' creates a working link

Role fields must be submitted with a single message and all roles must be @ mentioned.
Ex. @Role1, @Role2, @Role3.

Recipes are automatically hidden from users- edit the 'Is Public' field to make it visible.
editrecipefield.description: Edit a field of an recipe in the shop. Use /editrecipemenu first to see the fields of an recipe

editrecipemenu.help: Shows the edit recipe menu for the specified recipe. This will allow you to edit the fields of the recipe. Use /allrecipes to see a list of all recipes.

THIS IS A DESTRUCTIVE COMMAND

This will remove an item from the shop. This cannot be undone, and may create issues with existing items in user inventories- contact Alex if you really need to do this and the item is already in use.

updateallitemversions.help:
Generally recommend Alex does this, as he can check the database to ensure all went smoothly.

This command updates the attribute version of all items in the shop- i.e. this fixes the situation if a new field has been added to the item schema but some items are still on the previous schema
updateallitemversions.description: Update the version of all items

updateitemversion.help:
Generally recommend Alex does this, as he can check the database to ensure all went smoothly.

This command updates the attribute version of an item in the shop- i.e. this fixes the situation if a new field has been added to the item schema but the item is still on the previous schema
updateitemversion.description: Update the version of an item in the shop to new attributes

editfield.help: Edit a field of an item, as listed with the /editemmenu command. Leave the value option blank to remove this option from the item.
